verses.verse: For all people walk each in the name of his god, But (Zech. 10:12) we will walk in the name of the LORD our God Forever and ever.
Zion’s Future Triumph“In that day,” says the LORD, (Ezek. 34:16) “I will assemble the lame, (Ps. 147:2) I will gather the outcast And those whom I have afflicted;
I will make the lame (Mic. 2:12) a remnant, And the outcast a strong nation; So the LORD ((Is. 9:6; 24:23; Luke 1:33; Rev. 11:15)) will reign over them in Mount Zion From now on, even forever.
And you, O tower of the flock, The stronghold of the daughter of Zion, To you shall it come, Even the former dominion shall come, The kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.”
Now why do you cry aloud? (Jer. 8:19) Is there no king in your midst? Has your counselor perished? For (Is. 13:8; Jer. 30:6) pangs have seized you like a woman in labor.

Be in pain, and labor to bring forth, O daughter of Zion, Like a woman in birth pangs. For now you shall go forth from the city, You shall dwell in the field, And to (2 Chr. 36:20; Amos 5:27) Babylon you shall go. There you shall be delivered; There the ((Is. 45:13; Mic. 7:8-12)) LORD will (Ezra 1:1-3; 2:1; Ps. 18:17) redeem you From the hand of your enemies.
(Lam. 2:16) Now also many nations have gathered against you, Who say, “Let her be defiled, And let our eye (Obad. 12) look upon Zion.”
But they do not know ((Is. 55:8, 9)) the thoughts of the LORD, Nor do they understand His counsel; For He will gather them (Is. 21:10) like sheaves to the threshing floor.

“Arise (Jer. 51:33; (Zech. 12:1-8; 14:14)) and (Is. 41:15) thresh, O daughter of Zion; For I will make your horn iron, And I will make your hooves bronze; You shall (Dan. 2:44) beat in pieces many peoples; (Is. 18:7) I will consecrate their gain to the LORD, And their substance to (Zech. 4:14) the Lord of the whole earth.”

Now gather yourself in troops, O daughter of troops; He has laid siege against us; They will (1 Kin. 22:24; Job 16:10; Lam. 3:30; Matt. 27:30; Mark 15:19) strike the judge of Israel with a rod on the cheek.

The Coming Messiah“But you, (Is. 11:1; Matt. 2:6; Luke 2:4, 11; John 7:42) Bethlehem (Gen. 35:19; 48:7; Ruth 4:11) Ephrathah, Though you are little (1 Sam. 23:23) among the (Ex. 18:25) thousands of Judah, Yet out of you shall come forth to Me The One to be ((Gen. 49:10; Is. 9:6)) Ruler in Israel, (Ps. 90:2; (John 1:1)) Whose goings forth are from of old, From everlasting.”

Therefore He shall give them up, Until the time that (Hos. 11:8; Mic. 4:10) she who is in labor has given birth; Then (Mic. 4:7; 7:18) the remnant of His brethren Shall return to the children of Israel.

And He shall stand and ((Is. 40:11; 49:9; Ezek. 34:13-15, 23, 24); Mic. 7:14) feed His flock In the strength of the LORD, In the majesty of the name of the LORD His God; And they shall abide, For now He (Ps. 72:8; Is. 52:13; Zech. 9:10; (Luke 1:32)) shall be great To the ends of the earth;

And this One ((Is. 9:6); Luke 2:14; (Eph. 2:14; Col. 1:20)) shall be peace. When the Assyrian comes into our land, And when he treads in our palaces, Then we will raise against him Seven shepherds and eight princely men.

Judgment on Israel’s EnemiesThey shall waste with the sword the land of Assyria, And the land of (Gen. 10:8-11) Nimrod at its entrances; Thus He shall (Is. 14:25; Luke 1:71) deliver us from the Assyrian, When he comes into our land And when he treads within our borders.
